newsitem.title: INDIA: India metals mixed as trade awaits new state rates.
newsitem.headline: India metals mixed as trade awaits new state rates.

text.p: Indian metals prices were mixed on Thursday as the trade awaited the new selling prices for February by state agencies, dealers said.
Zinc fell by 50 rupees to 6,750 rupees per quintal on low demand and light profit-taking. Zinc was up by 100 rupees last week and by 50 rupees so far this week.

Copper was steady at 12,850 rupees per quintal, aluminium at 7,250 rupees and lead at 4,550 rupees per quintal on thin activity. Tin was available at last levels of 34,400 rupees per quintal and nickel at 36,500 rupees per quintal on nominal trade.
Traders said that state-owned Hindustan Copper Ltd was likely to raise selling prices of copper by 5,000/7,000 rupees per tonne for February.
